I sleep with ear plugs and my husband can sleep thru a marching band so it didn't bother us ... but light sleepers it may. Parking is expensive ... as all downtown hotels are. There is a parking garage right down the street that is 10 dollars less a day on week days and 16 dollars less on weekends that will save a few dollars. It may be worth it for longer stays. The public transit has a stop right outside The Bristol door which is super nice. Public transit in San Diego is a must as finding parking anywhere downtown / harbor area is IMPOSSIBLE. Location is perfect. The Bristol is positioned right in the middle of the harbor and the Gaslamp and one block from Horton Plaza. Some have mentioned many homeless/ pan handlers due to hotels proximity to the bus station ... it's no more than any other big city downtown location. Actually, I'd say far less. My guess is that people that have that complaint are not familiar with urban/downtown living. The Bristol is a nice hotel in a great location and while it's not 5 star as others have mentioned it is very clean and has a fantastic staff. I'd gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Workingman247
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place for the price. Good and bad location. Walking distance to everything including Gaslamp district, sea village and shopping. The only shock is if your from a cold weather climate is the amount of homeless. Its right next to a bus station and there are gobs of homeless everywhere. But I guess they are all over the city so you really cant avoid them Its a little sketchy walking back at night so some people may feel better staying closer to the gaslamp or a few blocks up or at in the sea village otr better yet just get a cab. If I could do it again I would stay at one of the big hotels next to the sea village.

Reviews.Title: “Expected nice but the Bristol was much better”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: We arrived in early morning and went by hoping to be able to drop off luggage. We were upgraded to a nicer room which was already available. Everything was uphill from there. Staff bent over backwards to be helpful, room was very large for an older hotel and it was so renovated that it was impossible to tell that it was older. Location was perfect as we usually hate to drive on vacation. Location was 1-block from the bus stops, even the bus from the airport which beats renting a car and paying for parking. About a block from the trolley stop and the Transit Store was right on the corner. Buy a 4-day pass for bus & trolley for $15. Service in San Diego is great for a Western City. The Greyhound Station was across the street but almost unnoticeable. There were a few non-aggressive transients around but no more that the rest of downtown. Many fine restaurants within reasonable walking distance-in fact we think this was the best possible downtown location an a great hotel to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Cool vibe...good locale.....great staff”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Was in town for seminar at Westin and it was sold out. Booked this for location and was extremely pleased. It was $90 cheaper than Westin's group rate and it is only about 300 yrds away. I booked the standard king room for 127/night. The room was in good shape and modern. There was a coffee pot with Seattle's best coffee. The soaps and bath products were natural and of good quality and replaced daily. Room was clean with black marble countertops and good water pressure. the minibar was one where you could place your own stuff in it. Bar did happy hour daily with 1/2 off appetizers. The app I had was fantastic and Debbie in the bar was great. (bar closes at ten though)Check in with Derek was easy and they honored my request for quiet room by placing me on backside of hotel. Five pillows on king bed and bed was comfortable. One light had a built in ipod dock and speaker. Elevators were quick and there was a bowl of green apples available at the desk for free. The hotel is across from the bus station but never felt unsafe or saw any issues. There are several nice hotels in this area and seemed policed quite well. High speed internet in room worked well and without issue. Also, there is an in room safe large enough for laptops. The only thing missing was the lack of paper cups to take coffee to go when I was walking to the seminar. The rooms had glass coffee cups. However, when checking out, the clerk asked if there was any one recommendation I could make to improve their service. she actually wrote my suggestion and said it was a good one. She may have been making me feel good but the point was that this hotel seems to care about how to improve its service and actually asked the question. The room could be a five star room but the hotel lacks the amenities of a five star hotel (concierge, spa, full business center) but doesn't have a five star price so all is good. There wasn't a pool and no business center but there are computers with printers in the lobby. I was very happy with my stay and would definately stay here again.......especially at this price point as it is one of the best values around. Other points. Hotel is at the (North?) edge of the gaslamp district and can be a little bit of a hike to petco or some of the places down towards Market. There is a Panera Bread, 7/11, wendys, Pizza Hut, sushi, quiznos within 1 block. Starbucks is about 2 blocks near the mall. There is valet parking and it was in the high 20's per night but was the standard for the area. Also...if going to seminar at Westin....would definately stay here versus Westin considering price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Brynette
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is a small boutique hotel downtown San Diego, very conveniently located. Staff are super-friendly,. Rooms and beds are very comfortable, Hotel is quiet, lovely atmosphere and the welcome at the front desk is warm. Valet parking staff are friendly, courteous and prompt. Restaurant is bright and cheerful, food is good, fresh daisies on each table. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Mirage2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights in January while attending a conference. Our first room was a little disappointing: kind of small, sink was cracked, water was not hot, bed was too soft. We asked for another room after the first night and got an upgrade to a much larger, and nicer, room. The room was clean, quiet and comfy. The staff are friendly and helpful. You can store stuff in the minibar (unlike some hotels where you pay a fee if you even open the minibar) and the wireless is free. The hotel is right across from the bus station, as others have mentioned, but we found it very quiet. The exception was the Sat. night when things got pretty loud in the alley behind the hotel. I think this is just the reality of the Gaslamp district. The only negative thing I would say is that the fitness center is very small and minimally equipped. Overall, great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Staff was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: travel4fulfillment
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night for New Years Eve with some close friends. Upon arrival the vallet, the bellman, the front desk attendants...evryone was so friendly and inviting! The hotel is in a great location...walking distance to so many restaurants, bars, and the gaslamp district! We decided the decor is...modern chic. Nothing too fancy, but very nice and CLEAN. The lobby was great too, they even had a piano that they welcomed people to play...people were hanging out in the lobby till the wee hours of the morning. It was nice that that was allowed and encouraged, not stiffling at all. In the end, it was a very quick trip but we all had a GREAT time here and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mcspiess
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter, and myself stayed here for a conference and were very pleased. Very accommodating staff, updated and comfortable rooms, and easy access to public transportation. Would highly recommend to anyone traveling to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Bristol”
Reviews.Author: flywife
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just moved to San Diego and needed a hotel for a few days while our apartment was getting ready. We wanted to stay downtown. This hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Our floor was pet friendly, which was perfect & the main reason we stayed here. No pet fees! Everyone we met: front desk, housekeeping, valet, servers were VERY nice and genuinely friendly and helpful. Our room was a king and HUGE. Very well decorated, modern & chic. We had huge bay windows. Comfortable bed with tons of pillows & luxury linens. The bathroom had a giant tub with a seat and a rounded shower curtain which was extra roomy. Our last night, we went to the bar in the lobby. We didn't even know it was there! It's hidden. I do wish the from desk had mentioned it because it's a gem! Amazing happy hour prices on martinis & appetizers. The portions are so big on the apps that we didn't need dinner! And Kevin our bartender was top notch. Even though we won't be staying at the hotel anymore, our apartment is in the neighborhood & I will definitely come back for the bar. *On a side note, anywhere downtown is noisy this is no exception. We did hear lots of street noise & the bus station is across the street. Didn't bother us one bit, but be ready for it.* Overall, the Bristol is great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kushta
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel and were really happy with it. The rooms were very luxurious and the beds were very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was a little noisy during the day, but being right downtown that's to be expected - at night it was quiet though. The location was perfect - we took public transportation to zoo and Sea World - bus & trolley stops right around the corner. If you like Sushi - the Sushi Deli around the corner is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great cute hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: inbal_b
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this cute boutique hotel. I was in San Diego for a conference at the convention center. The price was very reasonable compared to the big hotels right by the convention center. The place is super pretty, the bed very comfortable, staff was friendly and personal and very accommodating. It was a pleasure coming back to my room after a tiring day at the conference. It's in the Gaslamp quarter, walking distance from all the bars and restaurants. Actually, I walked from the hotel to the convention center every day, it was about a 20 minute stroll in the best weather ever, pure pleasure. There is a lot of attention to detail. The breakfast was good too. When I wanted to take a trip somewhere, they printed out driving directions to La Jolla and recommended places to go. Over all, one of the better experiences you can hope for on a business trip. If I ever have to stay in San Diego again I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: Shanberry
Reviews.Content: I have zero complaints about this hotel. It was amazing! My friend and I both spend a whole lot of time choosing hotels. We were NOT disappointed!!!!! On the first night, they told us they overbooked and would pay for our taxi that would send us to the Hilton Bayfront for the night. They also let us know they would comp that night's stay and we'll see a refund on our credit card statement. The refund didn't actually get processed until I emailed them about it a month later but I didn't mind. This was unexpected. Not many hotels would pay for the cost of the night at another hotel AND refund you. Adding on to that, they sent us to the bar to have a couple drinks on the house while we waited for the taxi. Our next few nights at the Bristol were fine. The concierge/receptionists were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was AWESOME. It was only a couple blocks from transit so we took transit everywhere. This hotel was WELL worth it. A++++ for value! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: CKing46
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms ( thanks Claudia, this room's housekeeper.) Exceptional front desk service and contemporary decor. Excellent value for the center city location. Would definitely re-visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: scottyinphx
Reviews.Content: When in San Diego, I normally stay at the Sofia across the way from the Bristol (a gem itself) but decided to give the Bristol a try this trip because I fancy myself a bit of a hotel connoisseur. I wasn't disappointed with the Bristol. The lobby is elegant with a grand piano and several areas for sitting, although enjoying any time in the lobby would be difficult as there really aren't any amenities to keep one occupied there. It's decorated, but not intended for use - at least that's the feel I got. The rooms are large and appointed with comfortable beds, a nice desk, and a chair or two with a table. We had no noise problems and any requests were promptly handled by the front desk agents. A few points of improvement might be the location of electrical outlets (which I realize is a harder thing to fix - just a pet peeve I have) and the lighting in the bathroom. It was fluorescent and directly overhead with gave the bathroom a very hospital-like feel. Overall, quite a pleasant stay. I specifically appreciated the man at the front desk who recommended the Red Pearl Kitchen to us for dinner - it was great. I think I still prefer the Sofia, but having both options in such close proximity to downtown and my favorite places is great! P.S. - to plug for another of my favorite places, St. Tropez Cafe is a wonderful breakfast spot within walking distance at C and India - $5 BOTTOMLESS mimosas on the weekends... can't beat that ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Close to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: SherryIL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 7-night trip to San Diego. We stayed at the Bristol Hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. All I can say is WOW. What a great hotel. The staff was extremely friendly (Ahmad, Marisol and Heather) and very helpful in recommending places to eat as well as how to move around SD using public transit (which by the way is wonderful). Also, we could easily walk to Seaport Village (on the bay), Little Italy, Horton Plaza (outdoor mall) and many restaurants. Couldn't have asked for a better location. Talk about clean, this hotel was spotless (lobby, public restrooms and rooms). I'm extremely picky about cleanliness and found this to be one of the cleanest hotels I've stayed in. We were upgraded to a king room with the extra sitting area which was nice. I thought the room was plenty big and nicely decorated in a modern chic way. We were located on the 5th floor. We didn't have view at all. Faced the backside of another building. However, we weren't in the room that much so this really didn't bother us. However, it is worth mentioning. The bathroom was large enough to accomodate two people getting ready and has the best water pressure I've ever felt. And, the contoured shower curtain rod was a nice plus. Another plus was the wall-mounted lighted magnification mirror. There's also a small coffee pot on the bathroom vaniety with tea and coffee (we didn't use it but it's available). The only thing I would upgrade in the bathroom (and in the hotel room in general) is the lighting. I thought the room was a little too dark. The king-size bed was very comfortable complete with a down comforter and luxury sheets. Slept great. I know some complained about the street noise, but we didn't hear a thing except once or twice a siren went off. The hotel itself was extremely quiet. And, the free high speed internet was great. Didn't have any trouble connecting at all. There have been a couple reviews about the area itself. You are right in the middle of everything. We did a ton of walking and always felt safe. San Diego definitely has a homeless problem. It's very evident all over the city. But, we didn't feel threatened or intimidated by this at all. Like I said, it's all over the city and definitely around the tourist areas. Our last day we ate breakfast at the Bristol and was very pleasantly surprised. The food was great with a good selection for breakfast. It was a little pricey, but so are many restaurants in San Diego. On a final note I would definitely recommend the Bristol. It's a great boutique hotel with a very accomodating staff who go out of their way to make you feel right at home. Special thanks to Marisol, Ahmad and Heather!

Reviews.Title: “chic & friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Dillicious
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and pretty. It was great news to hear, upon our arrival, that they had upgraded us to a sweet. Our room was huge and beautiful, and after spending a week in a rural part of Mexico, the shower was to die for. Hot and great water pressure. They're eco-friendly, so that's nice. Good location, a little bit of a walk to the center of the district. The bus system is awesome though, except on Sundays. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to others! The only bad thing would be the street noise, but hey, in the middle of downtown, it's to be expected. I don't know about parking because we did not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to everything you need”
Reviews.Author: kateandtokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the start of this month for our honeymoon trip around CA. Lovely hotel close to Amtrak line and Greyhound and minutes from airport - approx $12 cab fare. Helpful and friendly staff on reception and in the restaurant and bar. Good food, with healthy choices in Daisies at reasonable prices. Rooms are a good size with plenty of amenities and large comfy bed. We stayed at the front and did not get disturbed by noises. A great base for Gaslamp district and waterfront. would recommend a trip to the zoo, you can buy tickets from reception too. All in all, a very good choice and good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Amsmithy
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked 3 nights. Located in downtown. As advised by other travellers got room at back of hotel. Large, comfortable room, excellent beds. Easy walk to harbour, trolley and Horton Plaza. Very friendly staff. Probably a little over priced but there was a convention in town this week. Ate breakfast in Daisies at hotel. large portions but you paid for it. Found a better breakfast in the shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa0475
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful with good tips on where to eat and how to get around. The bed was fantastic and provided 2 great nights of sleep. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunseekersandiego
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced downtown stay in San Diego you would be wise to consider The Bristol Hotel. My daughter and I experienced nothing but comfort and courteous service during our 4 night stay. Rooms/beds were very comfy, clean and nicely decorated. Location really convenient to lively 5th Street, great deals duing happy hour are easy to find here and all withing walking distance of The Bristol. Trolley just around the corner took us to Old Town where we bused it out to La Jolla. Easy Peasy! Great Stay! Great Service, we would most defenitely book at The Bristol San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicolaC77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol Hotel in early September for 3 nights and found the staff, location and room to be great. Reception staff were friendly and the room was beautifully decorated and very clean. The hotel was a 2 min walk from Horton Plaza and a 5 min walk from the bars and restaurants on 5th Ave. The only downside I can think of is that the onsite parking was expensive ($28 per night).

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Explorerlb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Bristol while attending a business workshop. Every aspect of my stay during those three days was absoutely enjoyable. Their staff are personable, attentive and professional. The amenities are updated and appealing in the lobby, restaurant and rooms. The little in-room touches, like an I-pod base/speakers, hair dryers and robes are enjoyable, especially since they are often supplied in more expensive hotels. The bed was super-cosy and I slept soo well!! Rates were competitive - more-so with specials. I was able to have lunch at their restaurant and the food and service was very good. Location to area restaurants, attractions and public transportaion was very central. Horton Plaza is 1 block away. If you are a walker, the coast (Navy's Midway museum) is about 6 blocks away. Seaport Village is another 6 or so blocks beyond that. The weather was fabulous, as usual, so afternoon strolls were delightful experiences after being stuck in a seminar conference room all day. Greyhound is across the street, and bus and tram stops are a block away. Cautions: Try to request a room away from street noise if you are a light sleeper. Also, if you plan to have a car, parking (valet only) is pricey. Overall, convenient location and great amenities! If I ever visit the Downtown San Diego area again, I would absoutely return to The Bristol!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Frimeur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located downtown. Unfortunately it's across the street from the Greyhound station and a block from the city jail. Nevertheless, it seems quite safe, and there are nice places to eat nearby. I was at a meeting at the Convention Center, a ten-minute walk, and it worked out well enough. The price was exceptionally good.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sthmcr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of an Expedia package after reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. The room was spotlessly clean, had a comfortable bed and all the other amenities you could want; minibar, coffee maker, iron, safe (free) to name but a few. It just had the one king bed but it was pretty spacious and there was a good view over the city being on a high floor. Free internet and printing facilities in the hotel lobby were a real plus, and the staff on reception were very efficient and happy to give advice on local attractions and public transport. The hotel is opposite the Greyhound Depot in downtown, and as in any major US city centre there are a few tramps and beggars about, but we never felt unsafe at all, even walking back to the hotel at 1am. The only slight negatives for me was the bathroom always felt dark, even with the lights on, the bath was quite small, and the sink is like a bowl placed on top of a counter and the water seems to go everywhere, but those are all very minor things. I also kept walking into the stool at the end of the bed in the night with the lights off (it's black!). We chose not to dine at the hotel because we wanted to check out other places in the city, and had our breakfast at the Panera Bread store just round the corner. All in all, the Bristol was a great hotel and I would happily book it again if I was looking to stay in central San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming”
Reviews.Author: sassysarah22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bristol Hotel in late August for 5 days and had a a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly and knew a lot about where 4 girls could go for fun, thanks Bryce! The rooms were beautiful and the price was incredible. The ONLY complaint we had was with the bathroom door. It is a pocket door that sits OUTSIDE of the bathroom door, not flush with the wall so there is little privacy when in the washroom. If they fixed that and put proper doors on, it would have been perfect. It was less than a 10 min walk to the convention center and felt very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Davidedetta
Reviews.Content: The position is absolutely good, directly in the downtown! Rooms, very clean, nice and big The parking: is really expensive, 26 USD per night!!!!!!!! Room service: we asked for a breakfast for the morning, but nobody came to collect our order and the day after we didn't receive the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Staying here made our vacation truly a vacation”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl229
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the week of my honeymoon and loved it! All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They upgraded my husband and I to a deluxe suite. We loved the room, it was clean, comfortable and fresh new decorations. The location was close to shopping, food, buses and the metro station to get to tourist spots. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, and all for a great price! I will definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Aliceinlonderland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real unexpected gem. We'd been staying in a youth hostel which was pretty dire. We got to this place early to ask if we could leave our bags there and they let us check in. Getting to the room was like heaven. Gorgeous bathroom and lots of lovely touches. The decor was great and the bed was massive! The staff were extremely helpful and with breakfast included it ended up being the best value hotel on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: TigerB8r
Reviews.Content: I found the Bristol on Bing travel with an offer of 35% off for stays 4 days or longer. Total for 5 days was $488. I was blown away by this hotel. Room wasn't ready when I got there at 1, so I checked my bags with the bellman, and went explore the city for a couple of hours. The hotel is within walking distance to the many restaurants/bars on 4th and 5th (Gaslamp Quarter), is a block from Horton Plaza, and less than a block from the trolley stop. I came back around 3 and was told that because I joined the Bristol Loyalty Club before arriving, that I was being upgraded to the larger King room. Everyday serendipities during vacations make my trips extra special. The lobby is standard with a restaurant/bar right off the front desk. Around the corner to the elevators is a very chic area that has some couches. Throughout my stay as I came out of the elevators, I saw guests lounging here. Good meeting spot. There was also a pc and printer set up near here - good for me to print my boarding passes. There is free wifi in the rooms, but I did not have a printer, so this was very convenient. My room was on the 5th floor, at the end of the hall (I think room 506). I was very impressed with the size, cleanliness, and decor of the room. Very contemporary. There was an LCD tv, big dresser (I unpack if the trip is longer than 2 days), closet had plenty of hangers along with a safe and iron/ironing board, suitable work desk, and the bathroom was perfect. Not huge, but plenty of room, nice plush bath mat, great tub/shower, and all of the standard bath amenities. Bed was super comfy, and had more than enough pillows. One thing that I always complain about is the lack of electrical outlets in hotel rooms. This wasn't the case at the Bristol. And the alarm clock radio/mp3 dock was a nice bonus. My first night sleep was a little noisy. Everytime a trolley came to the stop just about right outside my window, I could hear the loud whistle of the electic motors. And the police sirens were annoying, but I thought hey, I am right in the middle of the city, and it's not near as bad as Manhattan. The next day I realized my windows were open. Duh!!! I closed them, and it was like locking my self in a sound proof chamber. One note is there is also central ac. I guess this isn't common in all San Diego hotels. With temps in the mid 70's and low 60's at night, it wasn't needed by me (I live in Florida where I deal with high 90's in the summer). Houesekeeping knocked on my door everyday by 10 am, and I usually wasn't ready. When I came back in the afternoons, everything was made up like new. My housekeeper even organized all of my personal toiletries on a hand towel in the bathroom. I wish that I could remember the names of the hotel staff that were so great - and I mean everyone that I enteracted with: the front desk, the bellman, housekeeper, night auditor - everyone was fantastic. The only negative thing that I have to say is that the ice machine was on the third floor, so it was a pain to refill my ice bucket. But that won't change how I feel about this hotel. I will 100% stay here again on my next trip to San Diego, and recommend this hotel to anyone that is going. Truly a remarkable hotel right in the middle of everything. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest, and the Westin a block or so away was over $300 a night. The Bristol was a better deal, with nicer staff, and even the bed was more comfy than Westin's Heavenly Bed. I don't give these comments lightly, as I love Starwood. But the Bristol earned my repeat business with every touch along the way. Thank you Bristol. I will be back. (Now I am going to try to upload the few pics that I took.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tara2009
Reviews.Content: If I go back to San Diego I wouldn't hesitate to stay in The Bristol Hotel again. The hotel is downtown, close to public transportation and walking distance to lots of restaurants and places of interest. The staff was friendly and willing to assist with any questions we had about the neighborhood, transportation, etc. We brought our laptop and took advantage of the free in-room wireless internet access. There is also a computer and printer with internet access in the lobby of the hotel. I used it to print discounted tour tickets and the boarding passes for our return flight. Noise from outside or from the hallways was a non-issue during our stay; we slept well all 5 nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: aaliyahDE1
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than expected and were able to check in upon arrival. Marisol was working the front desk when we arrived and she was so nice and helpful. She signed us up for the Bristol Hotel club( free of course) and we got and upgraded room . Though facing the grey hound station the room was spacious and comfortable. the hotel is super easy to get to from the hotel ( take bus 992 cost 2.25 and the stop is across the st ) on the back to the airport there is a bus stop directly on Broadway the main st !!!! we were able to walk EVERYWHERE from this hotel ( gaslamp, seaport village and even to the ferry terminal ) we even walked to the mission on 13th and J st in about 25 min.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Vic888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol from 21st to 31st August and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in San Diego. The hotel is in a great location downtown, close to Gaslamp Qtr, Highway and airport; and the front desk and concierge staff were very friendly and efficient. We had 2 rooms on 3rd and 8th floors which were large, modern, nicely furnished and clean. Free fast WiFi was provided and lobby has a computer and printer for everyones use. We did not use the Daisies bistro at all and it looked pretty quiet most evening ..that said there are numerous coffee, fast food and great restaurants within walking distance..... Walkers Pancakes House and Cafe Chloe on musts on Front St and 5th. There are quite a lot of homeless people around the hotel area ( greyhound Bus station and tram are round the corner) which is a shame since it spoils the walking experience; but that not the hotels fault. We had the long stay promotion rate of just over $100++ and its great value for such a location and great hotel; however there is a extra $26/ Day unlimited valet parking charge ( reasonble for area) .......... we would stay there again everytime we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel, for the entire Roadtrip”
Reviews.Author: emmaxoxo
Reviews.Content: This was probably was of the nicest hotels, we had stayed at for our entire 5 week roadtrip, the only problem was the bathroom and slow valet pick up. We stayed here 4 nights, the room was the smallest we had, had but this is downtown. The room was nicely decorated, double beds, the issue was the bathroom, was werid slide along door, that like to come out of it's hinges, and shower that liked to flood the bathroom floor, housekeeping always lined the shower edge with towels, the shower needed to be dipped into the floor. We had a car, valet was $26 a day, but this was the cheapest decent hotel I found in San Diego including valet, though you could have a wait alittle while in the morning to get your car. Good location, tourist attractions are quite close in SD, we never got stucked in traffic. Room could get nosiy though, we faced the Greyhound bus Station, and would hear alot of beeping, and sirens all through the day and night. I have never heard so many emergency vehicles sirens before, and I though San Diego was one of the safest cities. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you want a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: rollachick
Reviews.Content: Fiance & I stayed at the Bristol off a deal on Expedia (about $110/night). The location seemed acceptable as it was pitched as being "downtown." Neither of us had ever been to SD and had read reviews of thin walls but had hoped it was just a loud floor. I take a cab and arrive around 9:30pm to the hotel. Right off the bat, I notice the neighborhood seems a little sketchy and dark. There was graffiti on the wall on the wall next to the hotel. I was checking-in alone and a little nervous. The hotel had quoted me that a cab shouldn't be more than $8-10 for a cab ride when it was more like $12. The lobby was empty and I was checked in pretty quickly. I headed to the 6th floor (of 9) and had the last room in the hallway. The hallway had this smell to it.. almost a musty mildewy smell. I open the room door and immediately notice that we were given a double queen setup vs. a king setup. The one queen bed was completely pushed up against a wall. It seemed like an odd setup as most hotels do not have beds fully against a wall. I called down to the lobby to request that a king size room was provided as that's what we had booked. I was told that I needed to come back down and I would be swapped out to a king size bed. I was given a king size room on the 5th floor near the elevator. The room now faced the Greyhound bus depot and had a 100% increase of street noise. Sirens to buses to cars went by at all odd hours of the night. The rooms had Dell TV's which I found to be odd and only offered a few channels (about 30 or so). Premium channels were extra and the remote we had appeared to be dying as the range on it wasn't very long. The first night the hotel noise was limited as it was mostly empty. Thursday night, I definitely noticed a increase in traffic as well as people arrived for the weekend. I had breakfast in the lobby on Thursday morning and service was very quick and prompt. What was a little annoying was room service had a different menu than the restaurant lobby offered. I only went down to the lobby as I didn't want to pay the $3.50 delivery fee AND a 20% tip. This was all mandatory and would've made the breakfast above $20. The noise in the hotel seemed to increase each night as we moved into the weekend. Friday and Sat nights were definitely the worst as the hotel hosted a "20 year high school reunion" and the drunken folks were waking us up at 2:30am with their loud conversations and ramblings in the hallway. When I brought this to the hotel's attention the next morning; they told me that they "usually" try to keep the hotel guests with parties on the 8th floor and couldn't understand how they got down to 5. I understand that hotels can have multiple functions and events at one time; it is how they really make their profits but it was quite annoying to have super-thin walls (I could hear every conversation had) and even just passing hallway conversations from the bed (in the center of the room) with the TV on. The hotel bathroom was also odd as it did not have a traditional door. It was merely a 'sliding' door and you could still hear everything (super thin walls) as well as squeaky. The bathroom was small and the tub was non-existent. I definitely judge hotels by their bathtubs as I think a 'nice' one would have one you'd want to soak in. We had a rental car for a few days and $26/day is pretty steep (valet only) and we always called ahead as it took a bit to get the car. One of the nights we took the car out; the keys weren't located. We looked at all the keys as well as retrieved our ticket stub and finally located them. I'm not sure what happened there. We also had a mark on the rental car bumper (quite a large one) where it seemed the car was rubbed against a wall or another car. It came off thankfully so we didn't complain. Overall, the hotel seemed in a little sketchy part of town (the greyhound depot across the way with bus stops outside and always seemed to have homeless people hanging around.) Also, the hotel boasts of a ipod docking station but my room was broken. The dock was there but the actual 'insert' into the ipod itself was broken off. Also, there is no such 'business' center. There was a hotel pc with a printer downstairs but it was always in use and had a 'auto-reset' function every 15 minutes. It's not what one would consider a business center with faxing abilities, etc. Would not recommend as there are better hotels with views and more convenient locations.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Peachlett
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I met our friend in San Diego for an overnight prior to her business conference. We loved the Bristol Hotel! It's a charming boutique hotel on the edge of the Gas Lamp District, easy to find, easy to walk to 4th and 5th Avenues (the main commercial streets of the Gas Lamp),and easy to walk to the Broadway Pier (ferry to Hotel del Coronado, etc.). The hotel happened to be running a sale, which made our weekend affordable, also! We will certainly stay here when we find ourselves in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Price for family short stay”
Reviews.Author: bossladymum
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay at the Bristol this month in a 2 x queen room while travelling with my family which included 2 young children. Rooms were immaculate and provided adequate space for the family. Small sitting space plus large room ensured we didnt get under each others feet.. Baththroom very clean and tidy. Staff very welcoming upon arrival and suggested some lovely dining options in the nearby gaslamp quarter. Great value for money. Love the lolly jar idea too! Only draw back was valet parking fees at $28 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Best part: the location; Worst part: the location”
Reviews.Author: gefilte63
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the price. The rooms are adequate but not spectacular. Bathrooms are nice but the faucet and sink are designed in such a way that it is impossible to use the faucet without getting everything on the counter wet. Staff is very kind and helpful. Only exception: we asked for a recommendation for lunch and were told that there was a Wendy's at the corner...as if someone from Columbus (where Wendy's is based) or from anywhere else would eat at Wendy's with the Gaslamp district just a few blocks away. Otherwise, staff was really wonderful. The good news about this place is its location; it is an easy walk to almost every place you want to get in the central San Diego, and easy to get to I-5 to travel north or south. There is a mall located nearby in case you forget anything. The bad news is the location, right across from the bus station with buses coming and going all day and into the night as well. This also means an "interesting" collection of folks on the street below. This made for a LOT of noise. I would stay here again but try to get a room on a higher floor not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Tedilta
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, very clean, ideal location, close to public transportation

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: marcothibault
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Bristol Hotel in the wee hours of the morning due to airline cancellations and delays and also had no luggage. The night concierge was very sympathetic and kindly provided us with toothbrushes and toothpaste. Our room was very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The day concierge recommended some restaurants in the vicinity and after walking around and exploring, we found that we were in an area surrounded by restaurants and shops. The hotel was within a very short walk to the Horton Plaza shopping mall and a short drive to Coronado Island. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: The Bristol Hotel is a clean and comfortable hotel. it's very charming. The location is excellent. It's close to everything. The $26 per day parking was a little much but no complaints besides that.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Babos23
Reviews.Content: Great room and location. Young chap behind the desk was incredibly helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol felt like home during Comic-Con.”
Reviews.Author: Mira331
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bristol with my sister during comic-con. We had the best time ever. The staff there was just wonderful. Every morning we walked to the convention center early and then took the free shuttle back at the end of the day (took five minutes). A few nights we ventured out to restaurants in the gaslamp, but one night we ate at the restaurant in the Bristol and it was fabulous. Housekeeping was wonderful and the staff was so helpful and friendly and accommodated all our needs. Our room faced the adjacent building but we were not concerned with the view. Just happy to come back to a comfortable room after each exhausting day. The beds were unbelievably comfortable -- we slept very soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: fernelise
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter, within walking distance to all restaurants and stores but without all the noise when you are trying to sleep. The rooms are clean, big and decorated nicely. Beds are very comfortable. Parking is expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: jamnv
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Deigo and we were unsure of where to stay as we didn't want to rent a car and appreciate public transportation. We couldn't have picked a better location for all of our wants. Our goal is to find a clean and comfortable place to stay, and we found all of this at The Bristol. After reading the reviews I was comfortable with booking this hotel and after staying there, I would say this was a great find. We are used to walking and using public transportation and we had no problem getting around San Diego from our location. Our party consists of two moms and our daughters and we felt safe and comfortable at all times. You will not be disappointed staying at The Bristol.

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM!!!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun0
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! This place is hands down, absolutely fantastic! I wasn't sure what to expect, however it's SUPER clean, decorated beautifully, FANTASTIC staff. We will certainly stay here again when we go back. The staff was kind enough to let us check in about an hour & half early and what a view we had!!! We loved it! You will too!!! Note: there is a $26 nightly fee for parking we didn't know about, but again, it's worth it. It's only abt 5 blocks up from the fairy that you can take to Coronado island. However; for those looking to go to "the Del" realize that the fairy drops you off on the opposite side of the island. (we didn't realize that either) However we took the bus to The Del. Book at the Bristol....you won't regret it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBailey85
Reviews.Content: I had a 4 night stay at this hotel as part of a holiday to california and it was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were large and nicely decorated. The hotel has a modern feel with great friendly staff. The location is great. You can walk to the harbour, train station, and famous gaslamp district with lots of restaurants. The only downside to this is that the busy street noice can be heard in the rooms but not so much to be a bother. I can be quite critical of hotels and feel that city hotels sometimes are a let down, but not the Bristol. It is fantasic and would defo stay again and recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in downtown location”
Reviews.Author: diverse_izzue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bristol for an entire week. The room was large and quite pleasantly decorated. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly in a non-anonymous way. The location turned out to be great, with pretty much everything reachable by foot. I was provided with breakfast vouchers for the entire stay, which could be used in the restaurant downstairs. The breakfast was fine, though I would have preferred a buffet, as opposed to the served breakfast, because it's much faster. Another minor critique is the speed of the (complimentary!) internet, which was a bit sub-par. Those set aside, this was a very good deal and I surely enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: krazykev
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Bristol for 3 nights after a great deal from this site, close to everything - shops, Gaslamp area, everything. the room was fantastic -812- quiet and the bed super comfortable all the staff couldnt be more friendly or helpful when i arrived the guy at reception told me about the baseball game on that night and where to get cheap tickets. they even had the Aussie flag out the front ! the carpet and beadsperads are a little wild but i actually began to like them in the end! would recommend to anyone and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly Hotel, Good Value, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lolane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bristol Hotel for two nights in May. The best part of this hotel is definitely the service - we received excellent service from the valet, front desk personnel, maid, bellman and restaurant host (even though we weren't eating at the restaurant.) We stayed on the 4th floor (the dog friendly floor since we had our dog with us) and our room's window faced away from the street, so we didn't experience any of the street noise that some other reviewers complained about. The location of the hotel is right downtown, so you will have to deal with a cast of vagrants, transients, homeless people and drunks, but that's what you'd get at pretty much any mid to large city's downtown area. Our room was clean, the amenities were nice, the mattress was a little softer than I normally like and the bathroom was too dark, but overall this hotel was worth the money. It's in walking distance of the Gaslamp area as well as most of the things you'd want to do downtown, so the location is great. Finally, the only downside was the nearest grassy areas to take the dog. One is on the street where the train/tram runs and a lot of homeless people hang out, so I was a little uncomfortable taking the dog out late at night - I instead sent my husband. The other grassy area is near the mall, so it's a nicer area, but it's a couple of blocks away, so not as convenient for a quick bathroom break.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: NeedaGetawayNO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 3 years ago for 3 days. The staff was really excellent. I needed oxygen delivered for a companion and the front desk said it was no problem. When the company delivered the unit, the staff put it away and coordinated its pick-up after we had left. The hotel is in a great location close to the Gaslamp district where we hung out. I remember the room being very comfortable and the products in the bathroom were of a better quality than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: oswel
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at The Bristol because I needed a centrally located hotel in San Diego, and its price ($77 a night) was so much cheaper than anywhere else downtown. I started having misgivings that with that price, the place might be a dump. I decided to give it a chance, as I had stayed there many years ago when it was called The Executive. I'm glad I did. The hotel has been refurbished. I had a nice room with very modern, upscale decor. The staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable, and the place was clean. I couldn't ask for more, and at that price, it was a steal. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful affordable getaway”
Reviews.Author: GottaTravel13
Reviews.Content: We only live a couple of hours away from San Diego but when I found this deal for $79/nt at the Bristol Hotel we could not pass it up. It is a cute little boutique hotel in a prime location. Don't be deceived by the 70's architecture on the outside because it's much more modern inside. Our wknd was also started off right by the friendly staff & a free upgrade on our room. They also gave us an invaluable cost-saving tip....all loading zone/temporary parking around the hotel was free & unlimited after 6pm until 7am the next morning (sundays are free all day). Just make sure its not street cleaning day. Saved us $26/nt! The rooms were surprisingly spacious, clean & did not smell like pets (they allow pets in some of the rooms). The only downside was the shower/tub was very small except for a tiny person like myself. Two great bonuses: an ipod player & free wireless internet. Also, the hotel was in walking distance to the great nightlife on 4th/5th Ave. We've already recommended this hotel to friends & can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the location!”
Reviews.Author: knbouska
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for our 7 day stay at The Bristol through Expedia ($79/night). -The location was amazing! We were in walking distance to everything. My husband had a convention at the San Diego Convention Center, and he was able to walk there in 10-15mins. It was a block away from Horton Shopping Center. Ralph's grocery a few blocks away. 2 great breakfast stops within blocks (St. Tropez and Richard Walkers). A couple blocks from Interstate 5 access. -Great staff. Maid service was impeccable (watched her sterilize door knobs and scour out tub). -decor was very stylish and modern. (although building is obviously older) -FREE WIRELESS INTERNET ACCESS (and printer)! (computer in lobby if you didn't bring one) -comfy beds (room 506) A few cons: -Expensive parking ($26/day). Valet also occasionally parked our car off-site and would take 5-10 mins to retrieve. -Venting carried voices clearly and made it difficult to sleep when neighbors were awake. -LOTS of homeless people around the area. This was a huge problem throughout the entire town though--not just over by Bristol. Would definitely stay here again! Half the price of other hotels of similar caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Night”
Reviews.Author: lomigirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, his brother and I were in town to see the band Air and stayed here for just one night. The location was perfect (within walking distance to 4th and B), the room was a nice size (great bed) and the service excellent -- especially Kevin the bartender!! Room service was great, too; the breakfasts were much needed and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whidbey62
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a very good value. Room was very nice. Clean and well maintained. the lobby was very "stately" and though I never ate in the restaraunt, looked good too. The only drawback I could think of is it is right across from the local greyhound bus station....and I dont think I need to say anything more than that....many down and outers. A small distraction from an overall very positive experience. Front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating....Only a couple blocks from Gaslamp, some noteable nightspots like house of blues are nearby and one of the main transit hubs.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you from A-Z”
Reviews.Author: laruu
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and was greeted with smiles and kisses for my dog. I was hesitant when I saw where our room was; (elevator and ice machine.) I would ask for the same room over and over. We never heard the ice machine or the elevator and talk about convienient! My dog got to know Otis(the elevator) real well. Everytime we went to the lobby we were greeted by name. The room was huge and spotless. I have to say the hidden gem is the bar inside the Bistro Daisy. We were greeted by Martin the bartender who was priceless. We mentioned how good it smelled in there and he went and told the chef , Two minutes later Gabriel, the chef had sent out a small plate of potatoes for us to sample (killer). I ordered stuffed salmon on a whim (I hate fish) OMG I have never tasted anthing so good in my life. I could not stop eating. My husband had regular salmon and I heard him mew with every bite he took. Gabriel came out to meet us and we enjoyed him and Martin more than you can imagine. Wonderful people you have there!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING service”
Reviews.Author: mcclovis
Reviews.Content: My sister, sister-in-law, and I stayed at The Bristol on a recent stay in San Diego. We were all very impressed with the decor and size of the lobby as well as with the quality of art displayed. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier. Upon check-in, our host quickly took care of our room and informed us that he had chosen to put us on the 6th floor facing the marina so we could get a bit of a view. He said, however, if for any reason the street noise was a problem, to let him know immediately and he would promptly move us to the other, more quiet side of the hall. Now that's service. The location was good-just a few blocks from the bustle of the Gas Lamp District. But it was also across the street from the Greyhound station. If street/bus noise bothers you, request a room on the other side of the hall. The beds were divine and the size of the room was nice. The bathroom was nicely appointed but could have used better lighting. Adequate gym with enough equipment to get in a good weight work-out. A huge bonus was the free apples available each day and night for guests. The apples saved us more than once when we would find ourselves famished during our sightseeing. We would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and was another very nice stay. The hotel is in a very handy location to the convention centre, shopping and nice restaurants. The reception staff are very friendly and welcoming and I appreciated the phone call to my room shortly after arriving just to check that everything was ok with my room. The hotel has a nice homely feeling and you can just easily come and go as you please without any fuss. The free internet worked well and the hotel was happy to provide two access numbers so i could use my iphone and laptop. The back rooms of the hotel look ut to a concrete block wall, so I would suggest asking for a street front room with a view. Just up the street on First Ave towards the convention centre is a supermarket to pick up some snack food and nibbles. Dont forget to pick up the supermarkets discoutn card to get extra discounts. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this place!”
Reviews.Author: canadiantravel_bug77
Reviews.Content: I was leery as I always am booking a hotel online site unseen. Hotels always make the place look fab online and when you get there it just looks drab. I have had some pretty bad experiences with that. I must say though I was really impressed with this hotel. It was everything good people had to say about it and more. First of all the location is fantastic, close to a shopping mall, Gas-lamp District, restaurants and it's only a few minutes drive to a ton of freeways that can take you anywhere in the city you may need to go. The hotel its self is very clean and modern. It looks just like the website says it does. We stayed on the street side which I saw some people complain that it was super noisy. I didn't notice much noise at all on that side, but the back side is very quiet and the desk staff will ask which side you prefer when checking in. There was free internet in the room that worked perfectly. If you stay longer than three days you need to get a new code to access the internet as the codes run out after the three day mark, but just ask at the front desk and they will give you another one. Because it's downtown and people work down there parking is at a premium. They have full valet parking with is $26 bucks a night, you can come and go all day for the price. We actually got a half price discount on parking for driving a hybrid so we only paid $13 a day. All hotels down and around that area of San Diego charge for parking though and it's usually more. All of the staff were fantastic. They made us feel welcome and were very friendly and helpful. We asked about places to eat near by and the guy at the from desk gave us coupons for some discounts. Price wise you can't beat this place. I searched every hotel in this area and you will not find a better deal for what you get than the Bristol. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. I am heading back to San Diego in May and won't even consider staying anywhere else. It suited everything I was looking for perfectly. Location, quality, service and price.

Reviews.Title: “The Bristol Hotel helped my son and daughter-in-law have the wedding of their dreams.”
Reviews.Author: happygroomsmom
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter-in-law had their destination wedding at The Bristol Hotel in late December, 2009. The Bristol, located in a prime location of exciting downtown San Diego, provided a beautiful backdrop for the wedding and all the accompanying festivities. The hotel has a beautiful art deco decor in the lobby and rooms with a beautifully appointed ballroom. The fine art pieces throughout the hotel add to the atmosphere. The rooms and hotel, in general, were extremely clean up-to-date and well-kept. The entire staff was extremely helpful and accommodating in every way! From the beginning of the planning process and throughout the event, the service was personal and phenomenal. The small size of the hotel combined with superb service made our guests and us feel very comfortable. The wedding itself was amazing! Lisa Knoer, the catering manager, was attentive to every detail and helpful in recommending vendors for music, photography, etc. The menu was wide and the food was excellent. Lisa worked with us on pricing and was flexible and fair. Overall, I can't think of a better setting, the most magical moment being when the ceiling retracted during the bride and groom's first dance, exposing the beautiful San Diego night sky!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: hungrygirl04
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is a hidden gem close to all the restaurants, bars, shopping, and conference center (important for my business trip). It is incredibly clean and modern, with a spacious room complete with flat screen TV and roomy bathroom. It had stylish decor with contemporary furniture, yet still comfortable. I also like that it's a "green" hotel with eco-friendly shower heads, lightbulbs, and soaps. However, I think the hotel has a ways to go before truly being eco-friendly, including organic cotton towels and linens, energy efficient TV and refrigerators, recycled paper, etc. It's a start though! I wish the hotel had free or cheaper parking. Another $26 a day for the Valet parking, plus tip and tax, adds a hidden charge to the room fee. I also wish the hotel had a free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fun, walking distance to Gaslamp Qtr.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainLita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so we could go to a concert at the House of Blues and not have to drive back up to North County after. We were very pleased with the accomodations. Front desk service was great, it is one of the only hotels downtown with a hot tub. The rooms are a nice size (the botique hotels downtown can be rather tiny), have a fun decore and a great view of the waterfront. AND it was only 4 blocks from our concert destination. We had such a great time that I recommeded the hotel to my aunt & uncle when they visited in February. They had equally great things to say. The rates are good too. Valet parking is expensive, but it is at all the hotels that provide this service. It actually was about $10 cheaper a night than the Sophia's - which is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: OhioBean
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed staying here. good location, only 15 min from airport, yet quiet (rm 603). Very clean, nice decor and interior architecture, friendly and attentive staff. If lucky, you can avoid the $26 valet parking, and find a nearby meter spot on street, ie across 1st street in front of hotel. Would stay here again, especially on online rate of $79 +tax.

Reviews.Title: “Excellect service, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ajg14
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for the first time and met up with some old college friends. I got there a few hours early and the staff was really helpful and got my room ready before check in time. They were exceptioanlly nice and always helped me with directions and where to go for fun. Walking distance to everything!! Room was really cute and clean, I will definitely dtay here again. Only negative is its proximitey to the bus station, but they can't really help that.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautifull hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Flower53_10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel " Bristol" in San Diego surprised me a lot. The hotel is really beautifull, the staff is friendly, but the most important is location. It is situated exactly in the downtown of the city, in a walking distance from Gaslamp Quarter, and shopping area. Everything is very close. The design of the rooms is quite beautifull and not typical for the hotels of this range. I strongly recommend this hotel to both tourists and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: dakid23
Reviews.Content: The location was great, everything was close by and the saff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Bristol Hotel is one of the little gems in SanDiego and has the friendliest staff around”
Reviews.Author: Patricialynn
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bristol over the internet and were a little worried about how it would be. we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We liked the location as it was close to Gaslamp Quarter and shopping. Also, had some nice restaurants close by. The restaurants were a bit pricey, but nothing out of the ordinary for San Diego. The food in the hotel restaurant was very good, Rooms were a bit dated, but very clean. My husband and I plan to go back and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--tired room”
Reviews.Author: arascooter
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is undergoing a major renovation, which should be nice when its done. In the meantime, the rooms on the floors that are renovated are getting heavy usage. Our room was on the 8th floor with a view of water. At first glance, it looked just like the pictures online; but after closer evaluation we found peeling paint, stained bath rug, dirty/dusty coffee pot, the bathroom fixtures were worn out from improper cleaning methods. The room was just tired overall. Other than that, the location couldn't be better: we took the Coaster from the north, which dropped us downtown about 4 blocks from the hotel. After checking in, we walked 1 block to the Horton Mall to get some shoes for my husband at Macys, then headed back toward the pier- 4blocks- to take the ferry to Coronado. That night we walked to the Gaslamp district, very safe and lots of people out, for dinner and music. I would probably stay here again if the rate stays competitive ($79/night), but after further research, I think many of the older hotels like the Bristol, have the same plan: renovate and call yourself a "boutique" hotel, just to set yourself apart from the bigger resort-style hotels like the westin and hyatts.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Different Type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: thology
Reviews.Content: Spent quite a few nights at this hotel and I can critique on the following: Cleanliness: Overall, hotel was fairly clean. Housekeeping did a fairly good job in keeping the lobby area, elevator and common areas in a clean manner. Only downfall here was I felt as if the rooms and bathrooms could use a little more cleaning. Upon checking, noticed a bit of soap scum around the sink area (Not like it was a big deal, but still). Room otherwise, was clean and everything seemed to be in accord during check in. Only thing I didnt like was the fact that there were no plastic mats for the baththub. 3.5/5 here Service: No issues here in regard to service put out by concierge. Check in was fast and easy. I know I previously heard horror stories of non-retrieved reservations etc. Booked everything through expedia and upon my arrival, everything was good to go. I was even able to check in early. Staff was more than friendly during check out (think her name was Juana) and placed an extremely small hold on my credit card. Check out again was also seamlessly easily. Had a late flight and reservation desk was very accommodating with providing me with a 2pm checkout. Couldn't ask for better. Hands down, 4/5 here. Location: My opinion! I couldn't have picked a better spot! Gas Lamp District is close by, Horton Plaza is in walking distance, not to mention the Trolley and the wonderful restaurants that lie downtown San Diego. 10 minute walk to the bay area and 10 minute trip to the airport. Hmm, what else. Oh yeah, Little Italy is close by and all major interstates are within minutes. Previous reviews indicated that the area is pretty rough and noisy, but I can honestly that is SO NOT THE CASE. Don't get me wrong, the Greyhound is right across the street but to be honest with you, the noise wasn't that bad at all and my room was adjacent to the Greyhound. I can look out the window and see the buses pulling it but Noise was minimal. The worst you ever heard was the bus backing out and the odd fire truck in the dead still of night. There are a lot of homeless people in the vicinity but most of them lured more around the corner of First & Broadway. I went out many late nights and not once did anyone approach me..so overall I would say..you're pretty safe and its not all that noisy (4/5) Room: Room was of fair size. Amenities were decent. Only thing I didn't like with the room is there really is no fan or ventilation in the bathroom. I kind of liked the idea of the slide in bathroom door. Wireless internet in the room was pretty quick. Only downfall is that after three days you have to get a new password from front desk. Beds were comfy and I can honestly say that I had a good night sleep (even being across from the greyhound). Only other thing I didnt like was the fact that they blasted the AC and the only way to warm the room up was by turning on the heat. Walls are pretty thin so many times you can clearly hear your neighbour speaking and I mean you can hear EVERYTHING lol haha (3.75/4). Other than that no complaints. Overall, this hotel was definitely a different experience as it isn't your typical chain hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly. I like the ipod dock for the rooms. It was actually cool to put my ipod on and listen to some tunes before going to bed. Hotel is still undergoing some renovations so waiting for the elevator takes a while at times. Also, the swipe cards are pretty annoying. I had to get my card reactivated two-three times. But again, this could be attributed to the renovations that are happening. I would probably stay at this hotel again for the above mentioned reasons. Amenity wise the hotel does not offer much such as continental breakfast, swimming pool, etc. Despite the paper thin walls, after a day of having fun and a few nights at the bar..all the noise fades out as you fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and unfriendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: dulin38
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights over Thanksgiving weekend with two friends. Our first impression of the hotel was very good: great rates, great location, nice decor. After our first night, however, we discovered that we had bed bugs in one of our beds, had been bitten and started to have allergic reactions to it. After we requested it, we were given a new room, but nothing was said about compensation for our inconvenience. In the evening our physical condition became worse so that we had to cut our planned night out in San Diego short in order to rest in the hotel. We asked for compensation for our inconvenience but came across Scott, a very rude and unfriendly concierge who pretended he couldn't do anything for us until his managers were back on Monday. On Sunday morning we had to call an emergency doctor in order to treat our allergic reactions. This time we were helped by two very friendly ladies at the reception who, surprisingly, had phone numbers of several managers and were able to put us through to one. This lady at least agreed to put our charges on hold until we could speak to the general manger about compensation on Monday. In the end he waived the accommodation charges, but said they couldn't cover for the medical bills (more than 600$ in total). We were still very upset about the fact that we had to find bed bugs in a hotel like the Bristol and that some members of the staff weren't understanding of our medical conditions and our distress about the situation. I would not stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller111111
Reviews.Content: What a smart little hotel. We booked based on reviews here at TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. It is a nicely remodeled old building, with lots of charm along with crisp modern decor exactly like the pictures on the website. We had the largest room, a Deluxe King, for about $125/night including taxes, and it was both bigger and cheaper than anything we'd find in the nearby chain hotels. It was nicely spacious and good for a five-night stay. The service is efficient and friendly. The hotel doesn’t boast a lot of services but everything is quite charming and easygoing. The location is fine but definitely downtown, with some eclectic and shabbily-dressed folks hanging around thanks to the Greyhound station and nearby city bus stop. They mind their own business; in five days, only one person asked us for money. We found it perfectly safe, and frankly thought it made the area far more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ACWilson
Reviews.Content: I found a great rate at this hotel, almost too good to be true, so I wasn't expecting much from the Bristol. It was quite a surprise. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless. The beds were comfortable-soft sheets and feather pillows with down comforters. The towels were fluffy and soft. The hotel was really close to a bus transfer point, so you could easily reach anywhere in the city. It was also close to the Gas Lamp district, which made going out at night easy. There were a few downsides. It is right next to the greyhound station, so you have some questionable people wandering around at all hours. There was also a fire station right down the street, so there was some siren noise. I didn't notice it waking me up at night, but a light sleeper might.

Reviews.Title: “liked it, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ivydturtle
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night before attending an event in Balboa Park. convenient location in walking distance to mall and other downtown stores/restaurants. parking on-site. fun, modern art.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel unless you are under the ballroom! Tough neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Scout12563
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends whose room was on the 8th floor under the ballroom. Dancing and loud music until late above their heads. The kids at the party were then given rooms on the 8th floor with them. Turned out to be a miserable night especially when the front desk was helpless to fix it. The management should not have put people, other than the partygoers on that end of the 8th floor. Meanwhile I was sleeping great at the other end of the 7th floor. Lot's of transients and homeless around the building. Across from the Greyhound station, but close to the gaslight and all the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by the Bristol”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: I was down on San Diego for business which I am about every 6 weeks or so and my office put me here - they like to try out new places and know that I'm typically game. While it is not my top choice for places I've stayed around the Gaslight, it is definitely not at the bottom of the list either. The hotel is completely renovated, but still had a lot of the old charms of the old building that it is - lots of original molding and tons of character. The beds are really comfortable and the rooms are remarkably spacious (I wonder if this was a studio apartment building at one point and they just took out the kitchens?) and pretty comfortable. Free wifi is always a plus as well! The location is a little on the outskirts of the trendy area - you are across from the bus station which I had a commanding view of (as well as heard - didn't realize my window was cracked all night - but once I saw that, I closed it and it was super quiet). In the morning I used the workout room. It was a bit sparse (or modest as the front desk guy told me the night before) but the treadmill functioned more or less and I got in a decent run. I also had a chance to have breakfast in their bistro - the Daisy. I had the Parisian omelet as everything else was rather meaty and I don't eat that...it was quite tasty!

Reviews.Title: “don't overlook this place”
Reviews.Author: cbc115
Reviews.Content: It was between this place and the Sofia Hotel which is pretty much across the street. However it was either small cramped rooms at the Sofia for less or a bigger room with free internet at the Bristol for a little more. Just like the woman i spoke with on the phone, I definitely got a better deal booking with the Bristol. Which is another thing, i'd suggest calling and seeing if they can match the cheaper price you see on the internet websites. i was able to get a bit of a better rate for the room. Superior King Guest Room - VERY spacious. & clean. cute decor. Flat screen TV, definitely not HD tho. No HBO but other decent channels- TBS, nickelodeon, TNT, etc. Ipod compatible radio system. Round table with chairs. Our view was the street with a small sliver of the water out in the distance. bed was very comfy and big. Bathroom was clean and the shower area itself was pretty spacious. Nice Vanity mirror in the bathroom. and another vanity area outside the bathroom. Location - One block from Horton Plaza Mall, great for picking up last minute things at the CVS there. The plaza is also one of the Old Town Trolley Tour stops . 10 to 15 min walk to Fifth where the center of all the bars/restaurants are at, maybe 10-15 minute walk? About 15 minutes from the airport by taxi. We took the MTS to the zoo (10 minute ride) but the bus stop is by horton plaza one way and right on the corner of the hotel block on the way back. I'd say its far to walk from the Seaport village and Marina area, we took the MTS trolley. but the trolley stop is a block away from the hotel too. *On a side note, the San Diego public transit system is SO easy to take and it's clean and cheap! $5 for a day pass to use bus or trolley! they even have a number u can call to tell you what route to take to get to wherever ur going. Likes --cleanliness of the hotel/room, size of room, free internet!, staff was friendly & helpful with directions & other needs =), location Dislikes - a.) thermostat was weird. it was either OFF or freezing despite the settings. i ended up getting sick towards the end of the trip. but it was still a good stay. b.) so trivial but the lighting annoyed me. the one switch turns on like 1 dim light and the rest are lamps u have to turn on manually to get decent light. it's hard when u're in a rush! c.) and a full length mirror wouldn't hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLosthiker
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night and it was very nice. The room had a nice view of the city and a little bit of the bay. Our room was very clean and had a nice flat screen tv. The bed was really comfy. The location was great to walk to the Gaslamp and have dinner. We will book this hotel again in Dec. :))))))))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Neil012
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it. It was an excellent location close to shopping and transport. Staff were very helpful and friendly, rooms were modern and clean (if a little small). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Caranar
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best choices we made during our trip to San Diego. We expected a lot and got even more. The staff was very professional and helpful. The rooms are nice and comfortable and the hotel is quiet (although the streets outside are not). This is an excellent deal for it's location and accomodations! We will choose The Bristol for future visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming and unfailingly helpful, everything which epitomises the best of the USA”
Reviews.Author: weefee3
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all staff at the hotel. The rooms were lovely, plush pillows and comfy beds, big TVs and plenty of hangers in the wardrobe (which was a major plus for 3 friends sharing a room). Free internet in the lobby and good valet parking service. Location is wonderful, right beside all the amenities in the Gaslamp district from restaurants to shopping. Horton Plaza shopping centre is a 5 min walk away. Everyone was very helpful no matter how trivial our questions were, thanks again to all at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, nice staff, noisy street”
Reviews.Author: SwindlerTraveler
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic rate for the Bristol on TravelZoo. The staff was very friendly at check in as was the valet service whenever we got our car. The room was very attractive, but "cozy." Just fine for my husband and I. We were directly across from the bus station which created a lot of noise at night making it difficult to sleep.
